children.text: The gutters on the dwelling are full of debris, which may cause blockages to the stormwater system.
It is a requirement of Australian Standard AS 3500.3 Plumbing and Drainage Part 3: Stormwater drainage, section 4.5.1, that
‘There shall be no restrictions to the free flow of stormwater due to debris (e.g. cement, mortar, clippings and similar debris)’ .
All nails, pop rivets, mortar, and the broken bits of tiles all need to be removed, including any other building debris and waste.
